>
[Lion Blade Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=7724) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Dedication" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=41" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Shining Kingdoms](/Sources.aspx?ID=265) pg. 170

**Archetype** [Lion Blade](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=319)

**Prerequisites**
member of the Lion Blades; Trained in [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45)

**Access**
You’re from Taldor.

</column>

---

Your Lion Blade spy training helps you conceal yourself and your identity. You become trained in your choice of [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=38) or [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=48); if you were already trained in that skill, you become an expert instead. You also gain the [Additional Lore](/Feats.aspx?ID=5114) skill feat for [Espionage Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41). If you were already trained in Espionage Lore, you also become trained in a Lore skill of your choice.

You never take circumstance penalties for attempting to take a disguise of a different ancestry, age, and so on, as long as the disguised form is appropriate for your size.

<title level="2">Lion Blade Dedication leads to...</title>
[Expeditious Advance](/Feats.aspx?ID=7728), [Flickering Twirl](/Feats.aspx?ID=7732), [Inspiring Recitation](/Feats.aspx?ID=7725), [Lion's Magic](/Feats.aspx?ID=7730), [Lost in the Crowd](/Feats.aspx?ID=7726), [Slowing Strike](/Feats.aspx?ID=7733), [Spy's Countermeasures](/Feats.aspx?ID=7731), [Stunning Surprise](/Feats.aspx?ID=7734)
